snippet: Two years after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced plans to create a $15 million studio in Onondaga County, the hub is mostly empty and no films have been released....
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's highly-touted $15 million high-tech film studio in Onondaga County has yet to release single production, as it essentially vacant with two full-time workers; hopes were that studio would create at least 350 jobs, bringing a small version of Hollywood to upstate New York; studio's executives are now battling lawsuits and tax liens.

byline.contributor: Noah Gilbert contributed reporting from Marina del Rey, Calif. Doris Burke contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Two years after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced plans to create a $15 million studio in Onondaga County, the hub is mostly empty and no films have been released.

headline.main: Cuomo’s $15 Million High-Tech Film Studio? It’s a Flop
headline.print_headline: At Cuomo’s Upstate Film Hub, Some Drama but Little Action
